column4: hey guys, any REAL advantage of 64bit over 32bit besides seeing all your ram if you have over 3.5 gigs?
will 32bit see 3 cores? i have a triple core computer
im just having issues w/multimedia on sites etc w/64bit
so besides losing 500mb of ram.. will there be any negative effects using 32 bit on a triple core amd 8450 computer?
ok , will 32bit see all 3 cores just like 64bit ubuntu? i know it will "miss" 500mb of ram.. thats' ok as long as i dont have to worry bout "force" installing some of my favorite things
wont it use the same restricted video drivers whether its 32 or 64bit
it should, if you boot the live cd and do cat /proc/cpuinfo , you should see all three processors
if you use the -server version of the kernel, it should also see the lost memory
if you have pae hardware that is
working java plugin in the browser? (workaroundable)
I think you might get some better insight on the server kernel on #ubuntu-server. Maybe
no one is sure about an answer for you. I know a few things about the server kernel, but have never timed the differences.
no one has the answer, so chill for a bit. Ask the complete question every 15 minutes or so, if someone knows the answer they will answer
#ubuntu-server , or maybe #ubuntu-offtopic. the latter often has dev's floating around, and if they're not playing too much they answer that kind of question
